title: Big packet loss over past couple days
body:
I am assuming that my isp is the culprit here but i just want to make sure it is, i can provide network logs and tracerts if needed but before last week or so i would be fine in games and avg like 0.4 packets lost per min based on the site LogsofLag. 

So im wondering if a rioter can help me out

replies.body: Hmmmm that 0.4 packet loss per min does sound like it's a bit troubling, but it's a little different than what I'm used to seeing tbh. Could you shoot me a screenshot or copy paste what the traceroute showed?

https://imgur.com/a/K3oiW

Here is the screenshot of my tracert 

And here is a screenshot of my latest game from logsoflag, probably wont tell much but this lag is completely random in that it can last a whole game or a few mins and it can happen early morning or late night on any day

https://imgur.com/a/KpTlu

Yea it looks like that packet loss is enough to start causing some issues with online games where a constant connection is super important. With that kind of loss, you'd probably notice some slight issues with stream videos or other online games as well. 

I know it's not the best answer, but have you attempted contacting your ISP at all yet? All of those "Request time out" lines mean that something just isn't responding the way it's meant to. Take this traceroute to show your ISP, and let me know what they say!
I have not contacted my ISP yet but am planning on once i figure out the acc info on their website, i will get back to you when i get more information, thanks.

Same thing just started happening to me to yesterday last night.  Everything was running fine and then now the game becomes unplayable.  I've checked everything out and it all seems good on my end. Not sure what happened.
